dialogs.responseText: Hi. The name's Churbbles, but most folks call me the Sign Man on account of the weird name. Do you want me to make you a sign? 'Cuz I can, yessir, just bring me the materials.

dialogs.buttonText: Can you teach me to make a sign?
dialogs.responseText: Ooh, sorry 'bout this mister but I can't go throwin' away my livelihood by tellin' everybody who walks in that I can make sign ink with shuniku berries or that I carve white pine logs with my trusty wood carvin' knife.

dialogs.buttonText: Can you help me make a sign?
dialogs.responseText: I sure can! I love makin' signs, just bring me the materials and I'd be happy to help you.

dialogs.buttonText: What do you need to make a sign?
dialogs.responseText: I'll need a few things. First; It'll take three logs, white pine is best for seein' what's written on it. And I'll need some berries to make my special ink for writin' the words for the sign. I usually grab my berries from the woods down before the village. It takes a skilled woodworker to make a sign, ya know.

dialogs.buttonText: I've got the things to make a sign.
dialogs.responseText: Great! Here ya are, one "No Sulicitin" sign. Sorry 'bout the spellin', never learned how.
